(OOC)

People attempting to kill you off would be an improvement to the game I last
joined. You just get this wonderful fuzzy feeling when you respond to a
player wanted ad on ironies...get into the game and are ignored by every
GM...other than the one that informs you that the post you just made is
missing their structure. :)


----- Original Message -----
From: "polar_claw_ca" <dfinnamore@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 8:00 PM
Subject: Skullhammer at the Autobot Base w/ Pacifix


> (OOC)
> Ahh.so kind and encouraging, this group. Boy, I'm glad there's a
> bunch of you nice folks up here. Last time I joined a game, people
> all tried to kill me off right away. Not that I don't expect some
> combat.o_O;;
>
> (IC)
> Skullhammer's huge, grey form thundered across the plains of the
> African region. His large padded feet crashed along the ground at a
> great pace, striking up a cloud of dust which encircled and trailed
> after him like a tsunami. Powerful robotic legs pushed him onwards
> towards the base, his newly formed beast mode speeding nearer and
> nearer.
>
> His robotic mind, a network of circuitry and uplink servo-chips,
> accepted an incoming message clearly across the rapidly lessening
> distance between himself and the Autobot base. As he heard the voice
> and verification of being an Autobot, his tense steel muscles
> relaxed, and he continued on his pace. Amongst the heavy footfalls of
> his massive elephant form, Skullhammer made his reply with a high
> heart.er, spark.
>
> "Greetings Autobot Commander Pacifix. This is Maximal Infantry
> Skullhammer, approaching your base's eastern side. I've just landed
> on this planet. Most of my own sensors are offline yet." His voice,
> made up of a deep and even tonality in line with his large body, was
> clear even above the loud rumbling his four strong legs made as he
> rushed across the barren region.
>
> Skullhammer's pace quickened, shocking even him. The corded steel
> muscles of the Maximal warrior flexed underneath the pseudo-skin
> which covered him, propelling him along at speeds he didn't think
> possible for the somewhat unwieldy and sizeable form which he
> inhabited. His weighty body came closer and closer to the base until
> he was less than fifty meters.
>
> Well inside the range of the base's autocannons, Skullhammer skidded
> to a halt on a small stone ridge. The base was clearly an Autobot
> site, and was furthermore armed to the teeth, ready to unload a
> powerful and violent volley of blasts upon his metallic hide. He
> could almost picture the barrage of energy bolts and hot projectile
> fire being fired in a terrifying storm of death, and himself being
> stuck right in the center of it, if he were to make a wrong move or
> come under suspicion. His life as an Autobot told him the procedures
> Autobots followed.
>
> Speaking directly to the base now, closer in range, Skullhammer
> raised his voice in a clear opening statement. "Autobots, I am
> Skullhammer, an Autobot of Cybertron sent to assist the Maximals in
> their mission here on Earth against the Predacon forces."
>
>
>
>
>

>
